This bird is a Blue Jay, a passerine bird in the family Corvidae, native to North America. It is predominantly blue with a white chest and underparts, and a black necklace. Blue Jays are known for their loud, harsh calls and their boldness around humans.
This is likely a Blue Jay, a medium-sized songbird with a blue body, black wings, and white underparts. Blue Jays are known to eat berries, seeds, and insects.
